definition: animal hide/leather/to reform/to remove/to expel (from office)
to bend to a task and spare no effort (idiom); striving to the utmost
to bend to a task and spare no effort (idiom); striving to the utmost/same as 鞠躬盡瘁|鞠躬尽瘁[ju1 gong1 jin4 cui4]
to bend to a task and spare no effort unto one's dying day (idiom); striving to the utmost one's whole life/with every breath in one's body, unto one's dying day
pinyin: ju1 gong1 jin4 cui4 , si3 er2 hou4 yi3

sentences.english: Valeri took a swift bow and walked off stage .
sentences.chinese: 瓦萊麗快速地鞠了一躬，走下了舞臺。

sentences.english: He bowed and kissed our father’s hand.
sentences.chinese: 他向我鞠了一躬，轉而親吻了父王的手。

sentences.english: He made a low bow to the judge.
sentences.chinese: 他像法官深深鞠了一躬。

sentences.english: The figures Jean forward in an excessively polite and courteous bow.
sentences.chinese: 人物都向前傾斜，過分謙卑地鞠着躬。

sentences.english: He was so shy that he didn't say a word and just bowed.
sentences.chinese: 他太害羞了，一句話也說不出來，只是鞠了一躬。

sentences.english: He bowed to me and passed on.
sentences.chinese: 他向我鞠了個躬，向前走去。

sentences.english: The lady rose. I took her hand, and bowed.
sentences.chinese: 這位夫人站起身來，我握着她的手，鞠了一躬。

sentences.english: I sat by a fellow about my age 24.
sentences.chinese: 坐在我憊鞠的傢伙和我一樣大，24歲。

sentences.english: The conductor enters, takes a bow, and all is silent.
sentences.chinese: 指揮上臺，鞠了一個躬，頓時全場鴉雀無聲。

sentences.english: The dancing paper doll smiled without saying a word.
sentences.chinese: 他太害羞了，一句話也說不出來，只是鞠了一躬。

sentences.english: Charlie bowed and waved the flowers before he sat down on his seat .
sentences.chinese: 查理鞠了一躬，揮揮手中的花，坐下了。

sentences.english: He bowed and gallantly kissed my hand.
sentences.chinese: 他鞠了一躬，殷勤地吻了吻我的手。

sentences.english: He made a very civil bow to me.
sentences.chinese: 他對我彬彬有禮地鞠了一躬。

sentences.english: The gentleman bowed lowly before the lady.
sentences.chinese: 這位紳士謙恭地給女士鞠了一躬。

sentences.english: The housekeeper bowed very low in gratitude.
sentences.chinese: 女管家滿懷感激地深深鞠了一個躬。

definition: to half rise out of one's chair (a polite gesture)
to greet by raising clasped hands
to cup one fist in the other hand (as a sign of respect)
to bow deeply, starting upright with arms straight out in front, one hand cupped in the other, then moving the hands down to one's knees as one bows, keeping the arms straight (a form of greeting)
to return a politeness/to present a gift in return
to cup one's hands in obeisance or greeting/(fig.) submissive
